comments:
This course is the second semester of a year-long design project. Design projects in various areas of bioengineering; projects are chosen by the students with approval of the instructor in the Spring semester of the Junior year; a proposal, three interim reports, a final report, and a presentation are required. Also emphasized are proposal and report writing, scheduling, project risk assessment, multidisciplinary environments and ethics.

Students overall found the course to be “great” and “very good at exposing students to design process.” Although much of the course was “dependent upon receiving a great client,” one student wrote that the project “made me feel like an actual engineer.” In addition, several students noted, “a bit more structure may have been helpful.”

Most students agreed that Dr. Bogen “is nice and … helpful.” Although one student wrote that Dr. Bogen “was not very involved,” most believed, that Dr. Bogen “was more than happy to answer any questions we had” and “made himself available to help us through all our problems”

Most students agreed that the work was “tedious at times,” and one student wrote, “The projects require a lot of work.” On the other hand, one student noted, “all the assignments have a purpose and keep you on track for the whole year.” Several students believed that they did not receive enough feedback from the professors on the assignments. The Prerequisites for this course is BE Senior Standing.

According to the students, Dr. Buchsbaum was rarely available and the secondary course instructor.

Most students agreed that the work was “tedious at times,” and one student wrote, “The projects require a lot of work.” On the other hand, one student noted, “all the assignments have a purpose and keep you on track for the whole year.” Several students believed that they did not receive enough feedback from the professors on the assignments.
